author: kfogel
msg: Partially address issue #756:
* subversion/libsvn_wc/copy.c
(copy_file_administratively): Be stricter about disallowing copies
of copies, and improve error message for that case.
Note that this doesn't fully resolve the issue.  The truly golden fix
is rather more complex, see the issue for details.

author: sussman
msg: Second part of issue #493:  add '--recursive' feature to 'svn resolve'.
Again, use our generic entry-walker to accomplish this, yum yum.
* adm_ops.c, svn_wc.h (svn_wc_resolve_conflict):  take a 'recursive'
flag, and if set, use the generic entry walker to do teh recursion.
(struct resolve_callback_baton, resolve_found_entry_callback,
resolve_walk_callbacks):   machinery for the generic entry walker.
(resolve_conflict_on_entry): all of the main "work" code to
automatically resolve conflicts has moved in here.  This is the
routine called by our walker callback.
* adm_crawler.c (restore_file): update caller of
svn_wc_resolve_conflict, pass FALSE to recursive flag.
* resolve.c, svn_client.h (svn_client_resolve):  take a 'recursive'
flag, pass it thru to svn_wc_resolve_conflict.
* resolve-cmd.c (svn_cl__resolve): pass opt_state->recursive to
svn_client_resolve.
* main.c (svn_cl__cmd_table):  let 'svn resolve' to take --recursive switch.

author: sussman
msg: Another bugfix for a special ghudson 'deleted' scenario.
When doing post-commit processing, it's not enough to notice that a
deleted item has a greater version number than its parent: this
assumes that the deleted item somehow belongs in the parent revision,
which is *not* necessarily true.  For example: {svn add newfile; svn
ci; svn rm newfile; svn ci}.  This will still leave a 'deleted' entry
for newfile, and during an update, our state-reporter will attempt to
report newfile as missing -- by deleting it from a txn where it never
existed.
We debated adding new entry flags for this edge-case, but it's much
cleaner to allow our reporter->delete_path to allow no-op deletions.
* reporter.c (svn_repos_delete_path):  if the delete is a no-op, don't
throw an error, just ignore.

author: rooneg
msg: you'd really think i would have noticed this before committing...
* packages/freebsd/subversion/pkg-message
fix typo

author: rooneg
msg: As numerous people have requested, add a warning message to the FreeBSD port
of Subversion informing people that this is pre-alpha software and should not
be used in production.  For those who like to live dangerously, point them to
the development code on http://svn.collab.net and the developmentmailing list
at dev@subversion.tigris.org.
Feedback on the wording of the message would be quite welcome.
* packages/freebsd/subversion/pkg-message
add the warning message.
* packages/freebsd/subversion/Makefile
print the warning message in the post-install target.
